function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Siloed expertise in building science community and lack of integrated understanding of lighting, air, noise, and temperature impacts on occupants","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Privacy risks and security breaches from iot devices and data collection","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Capital cost associated with introducing iot and intelligent furniture in healthy buildings","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased use of voice-activated interfaces may contribute to the spread of contagious diseases by facilitating surface contact.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate spatial arrangements and movement restrictions may lead to crowding and increased transmission of contagious diseases.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of antibacterial fabrics and finishes may lead to a false sense of security and reduce adherence to proper hygiene practices.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty in quantifying the impact of new strategies and technologies on the economy, social goals, and environmental goals","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Buildings as a vector for contagious diseases transmission","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of common standards for building design to support health","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of interdisciplinary approach to understanding health implications of buildings","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Pandemic diseases transcending international borders","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission of diseases through various sources circulation, respiration/air, human/animal body, water, clothing, surfaces","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Historical precedent of quarantine in epidemic control","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Virus transmission in built environments","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of home quarantine","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of contact with hands, minimizing contact with door handles and elevator buttons can reduce the risk of contamination specifically for covid-19.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ventilating/cleaning clothes worn outside, washing hands with soap for a long time, and ventilating spaces are important measures to reduce the risk of covid-19 transmission.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relationship of the house with the exterior, including windows and balconies, has been important during the pandemic for visual and auditory socialization and well-being.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate isolation and quarantine facilities for infected individuals","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate disinfection measures for contaminated items and spaces","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Balconies as places for communication and social activities may facilitate the spread of contagious diseases between neighbors and residents.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Balconies as areas for observation and leisure activities can lead to close proximity and interaction between individuals, increasing the risk of contagious disease transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of balconies for daily activities like drying laundry and storing items can potentially spread contaminants or pathogens in the air or on surfaces.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Cooperation and interaction in residential balconies can lead to the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Aesthetic use of balconies can lead to overcrowding and close proximity, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Balconies used as smoking places","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Closure of balconies as a privacy mechanism","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of communication due to closed balconies","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of privacy and social distancing on balconies","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate performance evaluation of the balcony space","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of privacy on the balcony may lead to behaviors that increase the risk of disease transmission, such as talking loudly and playing loud music.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate cleaning and maintenance of balcony materials may harbor germs and contribute to the spread of diseases.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Proximity of individuals in apartment buildings during the pandemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High temperature differentials between day and night in the summer","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited rainfall and dry climate in konya","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliability of questionnaire data","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of cookies for website experience","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential exposure to covid-19 due to increased time spent at home","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate balcony spaces considered insufficient for use","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased preference for staying at home due to covid-19 concerns","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Low social distancing at home during the pandemic period","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Frequent leaving of home during the pandemic period","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High percentage of residences with multiple balconies","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Frequent use of balconies for social activities and food storage increases the risk of contagious disease transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased time spent at home and on balconies during the pandemic may have led to higher exposure to contaminants and air pollutants.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of significant difference in regression analysis suggests potential limitations in understanding the impact of demographic factors on health and disease transmission within the built environment.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Airing clothes on the balcony without proper sanitization may spread contagious diseases.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Arranging a seating area and buying furniture for the balcony may lead to increased social interactions and gatherings, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Significant relationship between balcony size and changes made during the pandemic process suggests that smaller balconies may face challenges in implementing proper disease prevention measures.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential lack of privacy on balconies due to visibility and distance from neighboring balconies and buildings.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"}]}
